content.body: I'd considered it a "slightly annoying but not too important" loss that you couldn't check, say, that the subject was a particular function (because you'd instead be invoking the function), but `=== fn` does indeed bring that back.
content.formatted_body: I'd considered it a "slightly annoying but not too important" loss that you couldn't check, say, that the subject was a particular function (because you'd instead be invoking the function), but === fn does indeed bring that back.

content.body: I'm not certain how often that will come up in practice, and we could also have `x is y` do a Same Value check first before trying the custom matcher
content.formatted_body: I'm not certain how often that will come up in practice, and we could also have x is y do a Same Value check first before trying the custom matcher

content.body: Except when doing `x is y()`, since that can only be a custom matcher
content.formatted_body: Except when doing x is y(), since that can only be a custom matcher
